Perhaps some of what JFunc implements will be moved into JUnit's code 
base.  I used the same license specifically to allow for this.  But that 
should only happen if it's found useful for unit testing.  If it aides 
functional testing specifically, there is a now a place to put that 
functionality to share with the rest of the community.

There will, of course, be gray areas, but what's nice about these 
extensions is you can use whichever portion you need/want without 
bloating the original framework.

I do have to wonder though, does anyone make use of the Assert class' 
static nature?  (Let's restrict the responses to all the 'nays' rather 
than the 'yays.')  I've only used asserts through JUnit's TestCase.

-shane

On Monday, April 22, 2002, at 06:02  PM, dvydra2 wrote:

> We had to change all methods in Assert class from static to instance
> for functional testing, the same approach as JFunc. Is there any
> benefit for Assert to continue to have static methods in the main
> JUnit codeline?
>
> Thanks
>
> David
subject: Re: [junit] Changing junit.framework.Assert to instance methods
